text:
I have access denied using "Deny all" inside a <Directory /> and an "Alias
/dirname/" pointing to a directory with access enabled using a "<Directory
/dirname/" and "Allow all".

If that directory is missing people get a 403 error instead of a 404 error.

This bug also happens in 2.2.2
creator: ftlofaro@yahoo.com

text:
Do you get the 403 error when you create the directory "/dirname" with
sufficiant permissions as well?

You did not told us what "Order" directive you set inside <Directory />. Try to
set "Order Deny,Allow" inside <Directory />. Currently, I suppose you have a
configuration problem.

After all, could you please post the relevant parts of your configuration?
creator: issues-apache@blubbmon.de
nick@webthing.com
text:
I recollect fixing a bug that looks like this, but not exactly when.  Didn't
notice there was a bug report for it at the time.

If your unusual Deny/Alias combination isn't fixed, please reopen and supply
more detail.
